headline: 'The Five' on if Biden's woke policies will haunt him in Virginia race

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello everybody. I'm Jesse Waters along with Judge Jeanine Pirro, Harold Ford, Jr., Dagen McDowell and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5:00 in New York City and this is THE FIVE.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: We're going to win. I think we're going to win the -- in Virginia. The race is very close. It's all about who shows up, who turns out. And granted, I did win by a large margin.  I don't believe and I've not seen any evidence that whether or not I am doing well or poorly, whether or not I got my agenda passed or not is going to have any real impact on winning or losing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: President Biden very confident about a critical race seen as a referendum on his failing administration. Polls close less than two hours from now in the fight to be Virginia's next governor and everything is on the line. The race, a dead heat between Republican Glenn Youngkin and Democrat Terry McAuliffe.  And education is at the top of voters' minds. An issue that McAuliffe says parents should not have a say in. Virginia has emerged as ground zero in the fight over critical race theory and who should be in control over what is taught in the classroom. McAuliffe focuses on teachers while Youngkin wants to empower parents in their final pitches.

utterances.speaker: TERRY MCAUILIFFE, VIRGINIA GUBERNATORIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: I want to build the best education. I want every child to have a world class education here in the Commonwealth of Virginia. As your governor, I am going to raise teacher pay above the national average for the first time in the history of our great commonwealth.

utterances.speaker: GLENN YOUNGKIN, VIRGINIA GUBERNATORIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: What we won't do is teach our children to view everything through a lens of race where we divide them into buckets and one group is an oppressor and one other group is a victim and they pit them against each other and we steal their dreams. We will not be a commonwealth of dream stealers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So this seems like a big mistake, judge, because I'm not a math genius but I would assume there are more parents than teachers in the commonwealth of Virginia and McAuliffe is just all in with teachers.

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Look, when you bring in Randi Weingarten at the end of the campaign, you have literally given up on the parents. You know that they're not going to vote for you. You know that because the school board ends up lying about whether or not someone was raped and sexually assaulted in a bathroom that all the parents are absolutely against the Democrats here. So the issue right now is whether or not this race presents an opportunity for parents, from both sides of the aisle, to come together to unify in a way that we haven't seen in this country in years. And this is a good thing about the race. I think that McAuliffe is over the top. He certainly has an advantage from the early voters. And Youngkin has to make sure that he gets a lot of voters out today.  But the bigger issue I think is the fact that McAuliffe has already made a decision that he is with the unions. He needs the unions to help him. That's why he's got Randi Weingarten out there. That's why he just promised he's going to give the teachers more money. I mean, that's the Democrat way.   And at the end of the way, if Youngkin wins, it's about the fact that people now are beyond party, beyond politics. It's about American coming together and hopefully it will be a model for going forward.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: When Joe Biden popped off at the mouth in Glasgow guaranteeing victory basically, it seems to be based on what? Do you think he knows something or do you think he realizes that could totally blow up in his face?

utterances.speaker: HAROILD FORD, JR., FOX NEW HOST
utterances.sentences: I think what he knows is he won the state by 10 points. He knows what judge -- the judge has shared that there's a huge voter turnout early on --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: -- and you can determine you know which party the person declares when they vote. So he's guessing about that. And apparently this morning, we've learned that there was a huge turnout in Richmond, Charlottesville and Northern Virginia. And the data shows those are normally places where Democrats fare well.  The polling has been tight. We had a big poll that Fox News released showing that Youngkin had gained some points there at the end. But McAuliffe had held an early lead before that. So, we're going to have to wait and see. I'd say the third thing, I was surprised by Glenn Youngkin's closing. I thought his close would be more we're going to take the commonwealth to a new place, we're going to create more jobs, create more (inaudible). Here's a guy that comes from business. And to the way he injected race at the end -- look, it may work for him, but I was expecting something more from him there at the end.  Terry ended on his note saying, look, we're going to do -- we're going to make education even better. I'm going to pay teachers more. He had to try to divert this conversation from some of the race stuff and some of the parent stuff. But we got a few hours left and we'll see who wins this thing. I wouldn't count him out.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't know if he injected race. I think the left injected it and then he defended that. Broke guy (ph).

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: Well, I just said in his closing argument is all I was saying.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Okay. Dagen, your thoughts. Are you going to make a prediction?

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to make any prediction. I was down in Virginia over the weekend, by the way.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: A lot of signs?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: A lot of signs. But you see, it's so south Virginia. For you newbies, its south of the James River.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: So that's red territory. But Youngkin was -- he needs to get out the vote in that part of the state. That's critical to victory particularly in southwest Virginia. When Terry McAuliffe said I don't think parents should be telling schools what they should teach, he meant it. And everything that he has done since then and now you know he meant it because he never learned from it. He told Chuck Todd two days ago that everyone clapped when he said that. He then -- he then said Virginia schools need to get rid of white teachers. Too many white teachers. Not bad lousy incompetent teachers, but white teachers. So you talk and injecting race into this? McAuliffe's on it. He, last week, said teachers are the true heroes of the COVID crisis. Well, that's smooching the rump of the unions. Not the moms who had to quit their jobs and give up their careers to sit at home and have their children educated on Zoom by said lousy teachers.   Then Randi Weingarten showed up at the McAuliffe rally, the wicked witch of unnecessary school closings. President Obama came to the state and then told dismissed belittled parents and told them that they're imagining what they're upset about in the schools.  So, this is all -- just sends the clear message to parents. He has proved over and over again that he does not care about what the voters care about in that state. We'll see how many people woke up to his nonsense.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Greg, someone reported that Terry McAuliffe had left his wife in the delivery room to go to a fund raiser. Did you know that?

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes, I did. I kept it under wraps. I was just coming out of my book. I didn't want to break the news. I wanted to wait.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You -- I wanted to tease it out.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, I was just in the green room talking to Harold and I told him, you know, Harold, the story isn't about who wins but how close the election is. I said that to him. It's not the reverse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But isn't -- just really, it's less a partisan election and it's a parenting election. It reminds me of the quiet guy at the bar who is being taunted and never gets up until finally somebody knocks his drink over and then he beats the crap out of everybody. That's basically what the parents are. They may not -- they may not pull it off this time, but I think the Democrats and the media got caught by surprise by the real things that matter to American parents, right? You have for four years an outraged media, an outraged Democratic Party over Trump's personality, his tweets. The effects on their emotional state mattered more than dead bodies, right? Meanwhile, the real issues kind of slipped right by them. COVID mandates, CRT, crime. So while the media and the Democrats were focused on micro- aggressions, parents were experiencing macro-aggressions, you know, through the education. Politics is a tug of war, as you know, between the people who go too far and the people that don't go far enough.   Right now, it's the leftists that are realizing how far they've gone and they need -- somebody needs to pull them back in and you see that how that they have turned, you know, the police into defunding and demoralizing the police and now you have the CRT stuff and, you know, being white at birth is bad. SO they're the one that have gone too far. It's now time for the Republicans to pull that back in and this might be a sign for that. Whether they win or not, I'm not making any predictions, that's not my job.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Okay. Well, we will see if someone's beer gets knocked over and, how many people they knockout tonight?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly. It will probably be me, downtown.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Stay with Fox News all night for special coverage of the election of Virginia and other key races. We're going to have results, analysis and much, much more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm not on there, see.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Next on THE FIVE, more bad news for Joe Biden. Voters in his own party are turning against him.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: President Biden is not on the ballot today in Virginia, but boy are the Democrats letting it be known how embarrassed they are of the guy. A new poll finds 44 percent of voters in his party want somebody other than Biden to be the 2024 nominee. Earlier while overseas, Biden trying to spin his leadership as a success.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: If you take a look at what economy is growing, the United States is growing. This Thanksgiving we're on a very different circumstance. Things are a hell of a lot better and the wages have gone up higher, faster than inflation. And we have generated real economic growth. As bad as things are in terms of prices hurting families now, trade this Thanksgiving for last Thanksgiving.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Harold, wages aren't keeping up with inflation in this country. Before we move on, at Fox, we have the voter analysis that you're going to see on the side of your screen from the elections today. So, keep an eye on that, but listen -- put your listening ears on as Judge Jeanine would say. Wages are not keeping up with inflation and inflation is running according to one gauge at the fastest pace in 30 years, Harold.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: So, I think that voters are concerned as I am and you are about inflation. I don't know how much voters are giving him or assigning all the blame to Biden and all the blame to those policies. I think the supply chain is having an impact on this. Democrats kind of lose their sense of humor about things. They're very reactive people. I'm one of them. They are frustrated right now with the fact that he can't seem to referee and reconcile differences between the moderates and progressives so, they're expressing themselves. But I tell you, if we sit here tomorrow and you invite me back at some point, and the New Jersey race goes Democrat, the Virginia race goes Democrat. You get Eric Adams as mayor here in New York, which is likely to happen and he really ushers in a public safety platform and changes the construct and direction of the city and they pass something in the House and the Senate even next week or so, the numbers will probably go back up.  But I don't quarrel with you, but as you and I both know, you don't give all the credit to this, but the S&P, the Dow and the Nasdaq all closed at records today. The Dow closed above 36,000. You get on me a little bit, but I'm a capitalist Democrat and I think those things are important for the country to be able to grow and it's important even for this president. If you're a Republican president, I'd be celebrating these numbers, reason I think we ought to give him credit for being at least a part of the story.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: G.G.?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, first --

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: I love the G.G.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. That was my nickname when I danced.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The super spreader.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, that was in the low days when I had to make money the hard way. You know, I want to say -- I was just thinking that de Blasio filed for -- to run for governor for New York, right? Didn't he, yesterday?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, that's, I mean, that's scarier than any of this. But anyway, so the 44 percent of Democrats want another nom -- want another person besides Biden. You have to remind yourself that the number was probably higher when he was actually running, but they said just get in and we'll figure it out later. So this is actually, I think for the Democrats, this is part of the plan, right? They never said we love Joe and we're going to stick with them till 2024. They just wanted him to get into the door and then replace him when he falls apart which could be in a year, it could be less than a year. The problem is the backup quarterback that they have sucks and they need a new one. They expected that they were getting like a youthful Joe Montana. Instead, they got a Todd Marinovich. Huh? How's that sports people?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: That's -- you're pulling out Marinovich?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: That's excellent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know who he is, right?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes, I do. He was one of the --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Todd -- what did I say?

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: Todd Marinovich. And then you said -- I'm with you. Todd Marinovich. West Coast man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, remember his dad? Crazy.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes. I have nowhere to go with that. Jesse, because again we're getting to a long conversation about the Marinovich clan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. No, I don't want to engage in a sports conversation with Gutfeld. That's going to go nowhere. But this is a poll --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's a great reference.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- this is a poll of Democrats so I have to put my Democrat thinking cap on. I have to slouch and frown and be jealous of Gutfeld's vast wealth. And so, the Democrats I know because I know Democrats, they want power. That is the most important thing. And so this poll acknowledges it. They don't think Joe Biden can win re-election and they think his presidency so far is costing them power in the House. Democrats obviously want their agenda enacted and so far Joe Biden has not really been effective at enacting their agenda. And then lastly, Democrats want to be inspired. That's why Democrats usually vote for the guy that sends the thrill down their leg. You know, Bubba or Barack. Is Joe Biden inspiring Democrats? No. He can barely make it through a speech that's in a teleprompter. So, he's boring, he's ineffective, and he's threatening their hold on power. That is the reason why Democrats are fleeing like this so significantly. And can I fact check him one more time?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He's comparing this Thanksgiving to last Thanksgiving?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We're actually averaging more COVID-19 deaths today than we averaged last year same time and same amount of cases. So, things have not gotten better in terms of COVID with Joe Biden on that metric.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes. And the truth is that Joe Biden is losing on education, he's losing on the coronavirus. In addition to that, the Democrats as you say, Jesse, are not inspired. Then you've got a scenario where the guy falls asleep in an international conference where -- and then he shows up at a climate conference that we'll talk about later, you know, with 85 car- motorcade. Everything he does is inconsistent with his message. He can't keep his own party together. Everyone is disappointed in him. And the -- and, you know, Kamala Harris, they've got nowhere to go with her. So, you know, they're like -- they're totally frustrated with their own party. And the truth is that when you've got Manchin coming out and saying that he's playing all kinds of shell games and he's got all kinds of budget gimmicks, nobody is buying anything that this man is selling. Nothing of what he is selling is positive or anyone wants to engage in.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: The only reason he was elected was to not be President Trump in style, but not substance.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right. Yes. Exactly.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Just in style. |And instead he comes in and immediately because, again, the Republicans lost in Georgia and immediately started --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- referring to LBJ and FDR.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: And that's not what people elected him to. Quite frankly, we'd be a lot better off as a country if he was asleep all the time.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, but then who's running the country? Do you know?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes, but if --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The American people.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: The American people?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: But what about schools?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They take them over. They pull their kids out

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Oh, when? When, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Tomorrow.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We're all doing this together.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't have kids so I'm not allowed to do that.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But I've tried.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: If we were on that Tesla on auto pilot, we'd be in good shape nationwide. Up next, stunning hypocrisy from Joe Biden and liberal elites shaming you over climate change.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Joe Biden waking up to serious hypocrisy after catching some beauty rest at the U.N. climate summit. The president under fire for crusading to save the planet while traveling with an army of advisers and a mass of motorcade. And eco warrior, Al Gore, is taking heat over his staggering energy consumption.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Mr. Gore, are you still getting a problem with your home (ph) in Tennessee? Is the fuel usage still as high?

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: We got to go. I'm sorry. We got to go, we got to go. We got to go. We got to go. I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: And Jeff Bezos sparking outrage over his hypocritical carbon emissions. The billionaire flying in on a $65 million private jet and lecturing the public that we need to reduce our carbon footprint.

utterances.speaker: JEFF BEZOS, FOUNDER AND EXECUTIVE CHAIRMAN, AMAZON
utterances.sentences: Back at earth from up there, the atmosphere seems so thin. The world so finite and so fragile. We must all stand together to protect our world.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: All right, Greg, who is the biggest hypocrite of the three of them? Al Gore, Jeff Bezos or -- who is the other one? We were just talking about --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If they all shut up --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- if they all shut up, their carbon emissions would be sliced in half. That should have landed better.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: We're laughing inside.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But I've got a point I want to make. You know what's weird about this summit, it's not evil but it feels evil because you have a collection of the richest, most elite people on the planet meeting together on our dime. They aren't paying for it. And they're going to decide how you pay and how you will suffer the rest of your life. They're literally living, I mean, meeting in a remote luxury spot to decide how an Ohio truck driver will bend under their thumb. And then the media applauds this. But this is like the most crystallized example of class warfare. You have a shimmering collection of well-protected elite couples, right, deciding how to fashion an apocalyptic vision in order to protect their power and seize more of it. They weren't even nice enough to invite like lukewarmer.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Somebody who believes in global warming but is more reasoned like Bjorn Lomborg to discuss the economics or the technologies. They think so little of us that they meet in front of us and mock. They're spending our money in doing this.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, to mock us. You're right about that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, is it evil?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It feels evil.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It feels evil.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Oh, that's right. All right. So, Jesse, Biden is in Rome. He's got an 85-car motorcade. Now, obviously, that's absurd. You don't have to talk about that. Who is in 85 cars? I've tried -- I was trying to figure it out. You got security, you got hair, you got makeup, you got a doctor, you got a nurse, you got -- 85? Who is in those cars?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Biden has a hair person? That's news.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He has a Depends person.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Who is in those cars, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You brought that up now two times in the last three shows. I know what you like to talk about. I don't know who is in the cars. I know this, judge, and you know that the industrial revolution combined with capitalism lifted all of us out of poverty over here and that was because of fossil fuels. Now, Joe Biden and liberals --

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- they resent that progress and they want to attack fossil fuels and they want to tax and spend to boost this green energy revolution so they can turn around and claim they saved the world. Fact check, I did.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Oh, that's right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, Joe Biden is killing pipelines and permits here in the western hemisphere and now is asking OPEC and Russia to increase production?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And then -- and just shoveling billions of dollars of our money to GM so then GM can buy electric vehicle components that are made in China. Then the whole thing is clearly a shakedown for these two guys, they don't even see it -- Kerry and Joe Biden. If you have the developing world saying, you're going to have to pay us trillions of dollars to go green, we're considering that. Bribing China and India to go green. They're just going to steal our money.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: It's a joke. It's a joke.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They're going to steal our money and they're going to keep doing all the other fossil fuels.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: All right. I want to ask Harold this. Okay, Harold. How do we -- how do we have our nation's emissions by the end of this decade while at the same time we've got Biden pushing Russia and OPEC to keep pushing out the oil and the gas?

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: So, I have a slightly different point of view about this. I think that --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, it's a question. Not a point of view.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: So to answer your question, you have to have an all of the above strategy to be able to convert ourselves to where we want to go. We cannot stop using oil and gas and fossil fuel products immediately. And anyone that suggests is lying. You can't fly on a plane, private or public without gasoline until we get to that point. Now, there are things we can be doing. The richest man in the world as I've said is an electric vehicle maker, Elon Musk. He's developing batteries and cars to do this. That's the future, whether it's two years, five years, or ten years. I do think there is hypocrisy. There's hypocrisy on both sides. But I do think if you're going to preach as some of my party members do about how we got to abandon this platform, you have to tell America and tell the world how we're going to do it and how this transition will be. I think it was right to kill the pipeline. I would not have done it. I don't think you should build more pipelines going forward. But one of the great things that happened over the last 20 years is we became energy independent as a nation. We produce more --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, under Trump, under Trump.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.sentences: No, no, it was actually done more under Barack Obama. Obama had the wrong posture towards energy and gas. No, no, but it's the real. This is the reality.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.sentences: But under him, we develop more independence than we did ever. Now, that's something we should be proud of. We were the first country to go to war with people, fight them and fund them to fight us at the same time by us buying all these gas products. So, we have to find our way off of this, I think for military reasons, for environmental reasons, and for economic reasons.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.sentences: I don't -- but I hope I answered the question.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: OK, wait, wait, wait.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, why does Putin get his pipeline but we can't have our pipeline, Harold?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes. Well, that's the question I'm putting in Dagen right now.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I mean, that makes no sense.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.sentences: I agree with you. We should have gotten our pipeline.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Look, when you bring in Randi Weingarten at the end of the campaign, you have literally given up on the parents. You know that they're not going to vote for you. You know that because the school board ends up lying about whether or not someone was raped and sexually assaulted in a bathroom that all the parents are absolutely against the Democrats here. So the issue right now is whether or not this race presents an opportunity for parents, from both sides of the aisle, to come together to unify in a way that we haven't seen in this country in years. And this is a good thing about the race. I think that McAuliffe is over the top. He certainly has an advantage from the early voters. And Youngkin has to make sure that he gets a lot of voters out today. But the bigger issue I think is the fact that McAuliffe has already made a decision that he is with the unions. He needs the unions to help him. That's why he's got Randi Weingarten out there. That's why he just promised he's going to give the teachers more money. I mean, that's the Democrat way. And at the end of the way, if Youngkin wins, it's about the fact that people now are beyond party, beyond politics. It's about American coming together and hopefully it will be a model for going forward.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: When Joe Biden popped off at the mouth in Glasgow guaranteeing victory basically, it seems to be based on what? Do you think he knows something or do you think he realizes that could totally blow up in his face?

utterances.speaker: HAROILD FORD, JR., FOX NEW HOST
utterances.utterance: I think what he knows is he won the state by 10 points. He knows what judge -- the judge has shared that there's a huge voter turnout early on --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: -- and you can determine you know which party the person declares when they vote. So he's guessing about that. And apparently this morning, we've learned that there was a huge turnout in Richmond, Charlottesville and Northern Virginia. And the data shows those are normally places where Democrats fare well. The polling has been tight. We had a big poll that Fox News released showing that Youngkin had gained some points there at the end. But McAuliffe had held an early lead before that. So, we're going to have to wait and see. I'd say the third thing, I was surprised by Glenn Youngkin's closing. I thought his close would be more we're going to take the commonwealth to a new place, we're going to create more jobs, create more (inaudible). Here's a guy that comes from business. And to the way he injected race at the end -- look, it may work for him, but I was expecting something more from him there at the end. Terry ended on his note saying, look, we're going to do -- we're going to make education even better. I'm going to pay teachers more. He had to try to divert this conversation from some of the race stuff and some of the parent stuff. But we got a few hours left and we'll see who wins this thing. I wouldn't count him out.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't know if he injected race. I think the left injected it and then he defended that. Broke guy (ph).

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: Well, I just said in his closing argument is all I was saying.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay. Dagen, your thoughts. Are you going to make a prediction?

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: I'm not going to make any prediction. I was down in Virginia over the weekend, by the way.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: A lot of signs?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: A lot of signs. But you see, it's so south Virginia. For you newbies, its south of the James River.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: So that's red territory. But Youngkin was -- he needs to get out the vote in that part of the state. That's critical to victory particularly in southwest Virginia. When Terry McAuliffe said I don't think parents should be telling schools what they should teach, he meant it. And everything that he has done since then and now you know he meant it because he never learned from it. He told Chuck Todd two days ago that everyone clapped when he said that. He then -- he then said Virginia schools need to get rid of white teachers. Too many white teachers. Not bad lousy incompetent teachers, but white teachers. So you talk and injecting race into this? McAuliffe's on it. He, last week, said teachers are the true heroes of the COVID crisis. Well, that's smooching the rump of the unions. Not the moms who had to quit their jobs and give up their careers to sit at home and have their children educated on Zoom by said lousy teachers. Then Randi Weingarten showed up at the McAuliffe rally, the wicked witch of unnecessary school closings. President Obama came to the state and then told dismissed belittled parents and told them that they're imagining what they're upset about in the schools. So, this is all -- just sends the clear message to parents. He has proved over and over again that he does not care about what the voters care about in that state. We'll see how many people woke up to his nonsense.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.utterance: Greg, someone reported that Terry McAuliffe had left his wife in the delivery room to go to a fund raiser. Did you know that?

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes, I did. I kept it under wraps. I was just coming out of my book. I didn't want to break the news. I wanted to wait.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You -- I wanted to tease it out.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, I was just in the green room talking to Harold and I told him, you know, Harold, the story isn't about who wins but how close the election is. I said that to him. It's not the reverse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But isn't -- just really, it's less a partisan election and it's a parenting election. It reminds me of the quiet guy at the bar who is being taunted and never gets up until finally somebody knocks his drink over and then he beats the crap out of everybody. That's basically what the parents are. They may not -- they may not pull it off this time, but I think the Democrats and the media got caught by surprise by the real things that matter to American parents, right? You have for four years an outraged media, an outraged Democratic Party over Trump's personality, his tweets. The effects on their emotional state mattered more than dead bodies, right? Meanwhile, the real issues kind of slipped right by them. COVID mandates, CRT, crime. So while the media and the Democrats were focused on micro- aggressions, parents were experiencing macro-aggressions, you know, through the education. Politics is a tug of war, as you know, between the people who go too far and the people that don't go far enough. Right now, it's the leftists that are realizing how far they've gone and they need -- somebody needs to pull them back in and you see that how that they have turned, you know, the police into defunding and demoralizing the police and now you have the CRT stuff and, you know, being white at birth is bad. SO they're the one that have gone too far. It's now time for the Republicans to pull that back in and this might be a sign for that. Whether they win or not, I'm not making any predictions, that's not my job.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay. Well, we will see if someone's beer gets knocked over and, how many people they knockout tonight?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly. It will probably be me, downtown.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Stay with Fox News all night for special coverage of the election of Virginia and other key races. We're going to have results, analysis and much, much more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm not on there, see.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Next on THE FIVE, more bad news for Joe Biden. Voters in his own party are turning against him.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: President Biden is not on the ballot today in Virginia, but boy are the Democrats letting it be known how embarrassed they are of the guy. A new poll finds 44 percent of voters in his party want somebody other than Biden to be the 2024 nominee. Earlier while overseas, Biden trying to spin his leadership as a success.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: If you take a look at what economy is growing, the United States is growing. This Thanksgiving we're on a very different circumstance. Things are a hell of a lot better and the wages have gone up higher, faster than inflation. And we have generated real economic growth. As bad as things are in terms of prices hurting families now, trade this Thanksgiving for last Thanksgiving.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Harold, wages aren't keeping up with inflation in this country. Before we move on, at Fox, we have the voter analysis that you're going to see on the side of your screen from the elections today. So, keep an eye on that, but listen -- put your listening ears on as Judge Jeanine would say. Wages are not keeping up with inflation and inflation is running according to one gauge at the fastest pace in 30 years, Harold.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: So, I think that voters are concerned as I am and you are about inflation. I don't know how much voters are giving him or assigning all the blame to Biden and all the blame to those policies. I think the supply chain is having an impact on this. Democrats kind of lose their sense of humor about things. They're very reactive people. I'm one of them. They are frustrated right now with the fact that he can't seem to referee and reconcile differences between the moderates and progressives so, they're expressing themselves. But I tell you, if we sit here tomorrow and you invite me back at some point, and the New Jersey race goes Democrat, the Virginia race goes Democrat. You get Eric Adams as mayor here in New York, which is likely to happen and he really ushers in a public safety platform and changes the construct and direction of the city and they pass something in the House and the Senate even next week or so, the numbers will probably go back up. But I don't quarrel with you, but as you and I both know, you don't give all the credit to this, but the S&P, the Dow and the Nasdaq all closed at records today. The Dow closed above 36,000. You get on me a little bit, but I'm a capitalist Democrat and I think those things are important for the country to be able to grow and it's important even for this president. If you're a Republican president, I'd be celebrating these numbers, reason I think we ought to give him credit for being at least a part of the story.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: G.G.?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, first --

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: I love the G.G.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. That was my nickname when I danced.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The super spreader.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, that was in the low days when I had to make money the hard way. You know, I want to say -- I was just thinking that de Blasio filed for -- to run for governor for New York, right? Didn't he, yesterday?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, that's, I mean, that's scarier than any of this. But anyway, so the 44 percent of Democrats want another nom -- want another person besides Biden. You have to remind yourself that the number was probably higher when he was actually running, but they said just get in and we'll figure it out later. So this is actually, I think for the Democrats, this is part of the plan, right? They never said we love Joe and we're going to stick with them till 2024. They just wanted him to get into the door and then replace him when he falls apart which could be in a year, it could be less than a year. The problem is the backup quarterback that they have sucks and they need a new one. They expected that they were getting like a youthful Joe Montana. Instead, they got a Todd Marinovich. Huh? How's that sports people?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: That's -- you're pulling out Marinovich?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: That's excellent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know who he is, right?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes, I do. He was one of the --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Todd -- what did I say?

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: Todd Marinovich. And then you said -- I'm with you. Todd Marinovich. West Coast man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, remember his dad? Crazy.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes. I have nowhere to go with that. Jesse, because again we're getting to a long conversation about the Marinovich clan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. No, I don't want to engage in a sports conversation with Gutfeld. That's going to go nowhere. But this is a poll --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a great reference.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- this is a poll of Democrats so I have to put my Democrat thinking cap on. I have to slouch and frown and be jealous of Gutfeld's vast wealth. And so, the Democrats I know because I know Democrats, they want power. That is the most important thing. And so this poll acknowledges it. They don't think Joe Biden can win re-election and they think his presidency so far is costing them power in the House. Democrats obviously want their agenda enacted and so far Joe Biden has not really been effective at enacting their agenda. And then lastly, Democrats want to be inspired. That's why Democrats usually vote for the guy that sends the thrill down their leg. You know, Bubba or Barack. Is Joe Biden inspiring Democrats? No. He can barely make it through a speech that's in a teleprompter. So, he's boring, he's ineffective, and he's threatening their hold on power. That is the reason why Democrats are fleeing like this so significantly. And can I fact check him one more time?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's comparing this Thanksgiving to last Thanksgiving?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We're actually averaging more COVID-19 deaths today than we averaged last year same time and same amount of cases. So, things have not gotten better in terms of COVID with Joe Biden on that metric.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. And the truth is that Joe Biden is losing on education, he's losing on the coronavirus. In addition to that, the Democrats as you say, Jesse, are not inspired. Then you've got a scenario where the guy falls asleep in an international conference where -- and then he shows up at a climate conference that we'll talk about later, you know, with 85 car- motorcade. Everything he does is inconsistent with his message. He can't keep his own party together. Everyone is disappointed in him. And the -- and, you know, Kamala Harris, they've got nowhere to go with her. So, you know, they're like -- they're totally frustrated with their own party. And the truth is that when you've got Manchin coming out and saying that he's playing all kinds of shell games and he's got all kinds of budget gimmicks, nobody is buying anything that this man is selling. Nothing of what he is selling is positive or anyone wants to engage in.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: The only reason he was elected was to not be President Trump in style, but not substance.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right. Yes. Exactly.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Just in style. |And instead he comes in and immediately because, again, the Republicans lost in Georgia and immediately started --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: -- referring to LBJ and FDR.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: And that's not what people elected him to. Quite frankly, we'd be a lot better off as a country if he was asleep all the time.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, but then who's running the country? Do you know?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes, but if --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The American people.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: The American people?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: But what about schools?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They take them over. They pull their kids out

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Oh, when? When, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tomorrow.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We're all doing this together.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't have kids so I'm not allowed to do that.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But I've tried.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: If we were on that Tesla on auto pilot, we'd be in good shape nationwide. Up next, stunning hypocrisy from Joe Biden and liberal elites shaming you over climate change.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Joe Biden waking up to serious hypocrisy after catching some beauty rest at the U.N. climate summit. The president under fire for crusading to save the planet while traveling with an army of advisers and a mass of motorcade. And eco warrior, Al Gore, is taking heat over his staggering energy consumption.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.utterance: Mr. Gore, are you still getting a problem with your home (ph) in Tennessee? Is the fuel usage still as high?

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.utterance: We got to go. I'm sorry. We got to go, we got to go. We got to go. We got to go. I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And Jeff Bezos sparking outrage over his hypocritical carbon emissions. The billionaire flying in on a $65 million private jet and lecturing the public that we need to reduce our carbon footprint.

utterances.speaker: JEFF BEZOS, FOUNDER AND EXECUTIVE CHAIRMAN, AMAZON
utterances.utterance: Back at earth from up there, the atmosphere seems so thin. The world so finite and so fragile. We must all stand together to protect our world.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right, Greg, who is the biggest hypocrite of the three of them? Al Gore, Jeff Bezos or -- who is the other one? We were just talking about --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If they all shut up --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- if they all shut up, their carbon emissions would be sliced in half. That should have landed better.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: We're laughing inside.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But I've got a point I want to make. You know what's weird about this summit, it's not evil but it feels evil because you have a collection of the richest, most elite people on the planet meeting together on our dime. They aren't paying for it. And they're going to decide how you pay and how you will suffer the rest of your life. They're literally living, I mean, meeting in a remote luxury spot to decide how an Ohio truck driver will bend under their thumb. And then the media applauds this. But this is like the most crystallized example of class warfare. You have a shimmering collection of well-protected elite couples, right, deciding how to fashion an apocalyptic vision in order to protect their power and seize more of it. They weren't even nice enough to invite like lukewarmer.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Somebody who believes in global warming but is more reasoned like Bjorn Lomborg to discuss the economics or the technologies. They think so little of us that they meet in front of us and mock. They're spending our money in doing this.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, to mock us. You're right about that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, is it evil?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It feels evil.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It feels evil.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Oh, that's right. All right. So, Jesse, Biden is in Rome. He's got an 85-car motorcade. Now, obviously, that's absurd. You don't have to talk about that. Who is in 85 cars? I've tried -- I was trying to figure it out. You got security, you got hair, you got makeup, you got a doctor, you got a nurse, you got -- 85? Who is in those cars?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Biden has a hair person? That's news.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He has a Depends person.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Who is in those cars, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You brought that up now two times in the last three shows. I know what you like to talk about. I don't know who is in the cars. I know this, judge, and you know that the industrial revolution combined with capitalism lifted all of us out of poverty over here and that was because of fossil fuels. Now, Joe Biden and liberals --

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- they resent that progress and they want to attack fossil fuels and they want to tax and spend to boost this green energy revolution so they can turn around and claim they saved the world. Fact check, I did.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Oh, that's right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, Joe Biden is killing pipelines and permits here in the western hemisphere and now is asking OPEC and Russia to increase production?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And then -- and just shoveling billions of dollars of our money to GM so then GM can buy electric vehicle components that are made in China. Then the whole thing is clearly a shakedown for these two guys, they don't even see it -- Kerry and Joe Biden. If you have the developing world saying, you're going to have to pay us trillions of dollars to go green, we're considering that. Bribing China and India to go green. They're just going to steal our money.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: It's a joke. It's a joke.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They're going to steal our money and they're going to keep doing all the other fossil fuels.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right. I want to ask Harold this. Okay, Harold. How do we -- how do we have our nation's emissions by the end of this decade while at the same time we've got Biden pushing Russia and OPEC to keep pushing out the oil and the gas?

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: So, I have a slightly different point of view about this. I think that --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No, it's a question. Not a point of view.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: So to answer your question, you have to have an all of the above strategy to be able to convert ourselves to where we want to go. We cannot stop using oil and gas and fossil fuel products immediately. And anyone that suggests is lying. You can't fly on a plane, private or public without gasoline until we get to that point. Now, there are things we can be doing. The richest man in the world as I've said is an electric vehicle maker, Elon Musk. He's developing batteries and cars to do this. That's the future, whether it's two years, five years, or ten years. I do think there is hypocrisy. There's hypocrisy on both sides. But I do think if you're going to preach as some of my party members do about how we got to abandon this platform, you have to tell America and tell the world how we're going to do it and how this transition will be. I think it was right to kill the pipeline. I would not have done it. I don't think you should build more pipelines going forward. But one of the great things that happened over the last 20 years is we became energy independent as a nation. We produce more --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, under Trump, under Trump.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: No, no, it was actually done more under Barack Obama. Obama had the wrong posture towards energy and gas. No, no, but it's the real. This is the reality.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: But under him, we develop more independence than we did ever. Now, that's something we should be proud of. We were the first country to go to war with people, fight them and fund them to fight us at the same time by us buying all these gas products. So, we have to find our way off of this, I think for military reasons, for environmental reasons, and for economic reasons.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: I don't -- but I hope I answered the question.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK, wait, wait, wait.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, why does Putin get his pipeline but we can't have our pipeline, Harold?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Well, that's the question I'm putting in Dagen right now.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, that makes no sense.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: I agree with you. We should have gotten our pipeline.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK, Dagen -- I'm going to ask Dagen that question. Why is it that he's allowing Putin to run the gas pipeline, and he shuts down our XL Pipeline?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Because he's weak, and he governs for the left, he governs for the green agenda. It's really a green religion. I think that he genuinely doesn't understand -- Biden doesn't understand and doesn't really like folks who have to drive to work for a living, that he is actively taking food out of the mouths of children by driving up the cost of energy, by driving up the cost of commuting to and from work. Biden's own climate lurch, John Kerry, said we could take our emissions to zero in this country, and it would not make any difference in terms of global climate change and global temperatures. So, we could all start riding bicycles, and it could look like an episode from The Walking Dead in the United States, and it wouldn't matter.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: What they're doing -- but what they're doing right now is driving up the cost of energy, because that's what they want. That's what they want to do. Because it makes these green fuels more economically sensible by doing that.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: And by the way, why is Elon Musk, the richest man in the world, still sucking up subsidies and money from the federal government? Why? Get off the teat, Elon.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. We should all get free electric cars if we subsidize this guy's company, right?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right, coming up, our good friend Brian Kilmeade is here. And he's taking on the radical left's war on American history. Here he comes with a chair.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I can't believe this crap. While the left tries to rewrite American history and put people against each other, Brian Kilmeade has taken a buzzsaw to their narratives with his brand new book out today, The President and the Freedom Fighter: Abraham Lincoln, Frederick Douglass, and Their Battle for America's Soul.
